repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/27400 

I considered also making `window` an option that could be passed here, but that seems like it could run against the grain of this module being requests for the "current buffer"

comment_data.body: We should not break the function by changing the signature.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1956,18 +1961,19 @@ local function make_position_param(window, offset_encoding)
 end
 
 --- Creates a `TextDocumentPositionParams` object for the current buffer and cursor position.
----
+---@param row integer|nil 1-indexed row number of position, defaults to current line
+---@param col integer|nil 0-indexed column number of position, defaults to current character
 ---@param window integer|nil: window handle or 0 for current, defaults to current
 ---@param offset_encoding string|nil utf-8|utf-16|utf-32|nil defaults to `offset_encoding` of first client of buffer of `window`
 ---@return table `TextDocumentPositionParams` object
 ---@see https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-current/#textDocumentPositionParams
-function M.make_position_params(window, offset_encoding)
+function M.make_position_params(row, col, window, offset_encoding)

comment_data.body:
I don't think using 1,0-indexing is a good idea for LSP APIs. see `|api-indexing|`. I think using 0-based indexing for all row and col would be better. The LSP protocol uses 0-based indexing for the Range representations.

The row, col indexing used for this function is only due to `nvim_win_get_cursor` and other mark-related APIs specifically.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1939,10 +1939,15 @@ end
 
 ---@param window integer|nil: window handle or 0 for current, defaults to current
 ---@param offset_encoding string utf-8|utf-16|utf-32|nil defaults to `offset_encoding` of first client of buffer of `window`
-local function make_position_param(window, offset_encoding)
+---@param row integer|nil 1-indexed row number of position, defaults to current line
+---@param col integer|nil 0-indexed column number of position, defaults to current character
+---@return table position line and character number within buffer
+local function make_position_param(window, offset_encoding, row, col)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
---@param opts? table additional options
```
Not only this place.

Also whitespace is not consistent on `col`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,8 +40,12 @@ end
 
 --- Displays hover information about the symbol under the cursor in a floating
 --- window. Calling the function twice will jump into the floating window.
-function M.hover()
-  local params = util.make_position_params()
+---@param options table|nil additional options

comment_data.body: This does not align with what is documented about the default values of `row` and `col`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1939,10 +1939,15 @@ end
 
 ---@param window integer|nil: window handle or 0 for current, defaults to current
 ---@param offset_encoding string utf-8|utf-16|utf-32|nil defaults to `offset_encoding` of first client of buffer of `window`
-local function make_position_param(window, offset_encoding)
+---@param row integer|nil 1-indexed row number of position, defaults to current line
+---@param col integer|nil 0-indexed column number of position, defaults to current character
+---@return table position line and character number within buffer
+local function make_position_param(window, offset_encoding, row, col)
   window = window or 0
   local buf = api.nvim_win_get_buf(window)
-  local row, col = unpack(api.nvim_win_get_cursor(window))
+  if not (row or col) then
+    row, col = unpack(api.nvim_win_get_cursor(window))
+  end

comment_data.body: d'oh, I forget the util module is public... I got annoyed by repeatedly passing `(nil, nil, row, col)`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1956,18 +1961,19 @@ local function make_position_param(window, offset_encoding)
 end
 
 --- Creates a `TextDocumentPositionParams` object for the current buffer and cursor position.
----
+---@param row integer|nil 1-indexed row number of position, defaults to current line
+---@param col integer|nil 0-indexed column number of position, defaults to current character
 ---@param window integer|nil: window handle or 0 for current, defaults to current
 ---@param offset_encoding string|nil utf-8|utf-16|utf-32|nil defaults to `offset_encoding` of first client of buffer of `window`
 ---@return table `TextDocumentPositionParams` object
 ---@see https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-current/#textDocumentPositionParams
-function M.make_position_params(window, offset_encoding)
+function M.make_position_params(row, col, window, offset_encoding)

comment_data.body: Gotcha, thanks for the context. I can make this 0 based for input without breaking the existing behavior
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1939,10 +1939,15 @@ end
 
 ---@param window integer|nil: window handle or 0 for current, defaults to current
 ---@param offset_encoding string utf-8|utf-16|utf-32|nil defaults to `offset_encoding` of first client of buffer of `window`
-local function make_position_param(window, offset_encoding)
+---@param row integer|nil 1-indexed row number of position, defaults to current line
+---@param col integer|nil 0-indexed column number of position, defaults to current character
+---@return table position line and character number within buffer
+local function make_position_param(window, offset_encoding, row, col)

comment_data.body: I originally named this as `opts`, but wanted consistency with the arguments that other members of this module already have. Should everything be `opts?`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,8 +40,12 @@ end
 
 --- Displays hover information about the symbol under the cursor in a floating
 --- window. Calling the function twice will jump into the floating window.
-function M.hover()
-  local params = util.make_position_params()
+---@param options table|nil additional options

comment_data.body: Actually.... I just realized that `buf.format()` and `make_given_range_params` is using 1,0-indexing 🤔 (which I'd want to change and break but it's difficult to change at this point). Probably wasn't carefully chosen in retrospect or there could be some reason, e.g. wanted to avoid conversion from the callsite; Some other core devs could provide more context and chime in the design choice.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1939,10 +1939,15 @@ end
 
 ---@param window integer|nil: window handle or 0 for current, defaults to current
 ---@param offset_encoding string utf-8|utf-16|utf-32|nil defaults to `offset_encoding` of first client of buffer of `window`
-local function make_position_param(window, offset_encoding)
+---@param row integer|nil 1-indexed row number of position, defaults to current line
+---@param col integer|nil 0-indexed column number of position, defaults to current character
+---@return table position line and character number within buffer
+local function make_position_param(window, offset_encoding, row, col)

comment_data.body: I see. Options would be fine then. Either we change all or remain consistent.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,8 +40,12 @@ end
 
 --- Displays hover information about the symbol under the cursor in a floating
 --- window. Calling the function twice will jump into the floating window.
-function M.hover()
-  local params = util.make_position_params()
+---@param options table|nil additional options

title: feat(lsp): allow passing position to lsp.buf functions
